label: Collections
description: Curated collections of media sources.  This is our primary way of organizing our media sources -- almost every media source in our system is a member of one or more of these curated collections.  Some collections are manually curated, and others are generated using quantitative metrics.
name: collection

label: Retweet Partisanship 2016 (Aggregate)
description: Sources divided into partisan quintiles based on relative number of tweets of election story urls by Clinton vs. Trump retweeters.  This version of the set has low certainity for individual members and so should be used only for aggregate question rather than the labeling of individual members.
name: retweet_partisanship_2016_count_10

label: Retweet Partisanship 2016 (Individual)
description: Sources divided into partisan quintiles based on relative number of tweets of election story urls by Clinton vs. Trump retweeters.  This version of the set has low numbers of members but high statistical certainity and so can be used to label individual members.
name: retweet_partisanship_2016_count_200

label: NYT Sections
description: Tags for stories based on models trained against the NYT corpus
name: nyt_sections

description: NYTLabels labels
name: nyt_labels

label: nyt_labels_version
description: NYTLabels version the story was tagged with
name: nyt_labels_version

label: Platforms
description: Tags identifying sources a social media platforms rather than direct publishers.  Stories within these sources are likely to be mostly discovered through topic spidering rather than through crawling, so this set is intended for use within the context of a specific topic.
name: platforms

label: Primary Language
description: Tags in this set indicate that most stories in the media source are in the language.
name: primary_language

label: Subject Country
description: Tags in this set indicate that a majority of the stories in the medium are about a country
name: subject_country

label: Media Type
description: Categorize sources by their original media forms.
name: media_format
